intro: Brachystephanus africanus var. africanus, commonly known as the African stephanus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces vibrant pink to purple blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or containers. Due to its ornamental value and relatively low maintenance, it is often cultivated in gardens across its native range.
